summary.long: Joel is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, you elders,
And give ear, all you inhabitants of the land!
Has anything like this happened in your days,
Or even in the days of your fathers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell your children about it,
Let your children tell their children,
And their children another generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, you drunkards, and weep;
And wail, all you drinkers of wine,
Because of the new wine,
For it has been cut off from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a nation has come up against My land,
Strong, and without number;
His teeth are the teeth of a lion,
And he has the fangs of a fierce lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth
For the husband of her youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The field is wasted,
The land mourns;
For the grain is ruined,
The new wine is dried up,
The oil fails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be ashamed, you farmers,
Wail, you vinedressers,
For the wheat and the barley;
Because the harvest of the field has perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The vine has dried up,
And the fig tree has withered;
The pomegranate tree,
The palm tree also,
And the apple tree—
All the trees of the field are withered;
Surely joy has withered away from the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Consecrate a fast,
Call a sacred assembly;
Gather the elders
And all the inhabitants of the land
Into the house of the Lord your God,
And cry out to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Is not the food cut off before our eyes,
Joy and gladness from the house of our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The seed shrivels under the clods,
Storehouses are in shambles;
Barns are broken down,
For the grain has withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the animals groan!
The herds of cattle are restless,
Because they have no pasture;
Even the flocks of sheep suffer punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The beasts of the field also cry out to You,
For the water brooks are dried up,
And fire has devoured the open pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow the trumpet in Zion,
And sound an alarm in My holy mountain!
Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble;
For the day of the Lord is coming,
For it is at hand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A day of darkness and gloominess,
A day of clouds and thick darkness,
Like the morning clouds spread over the mountains.
A people come, great and strong,
The like of whom has never been;
Nor will there ever be any such after them,
Even for many successive generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their appearance is like the appearance of horses;
And like swift steeds, so they run.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With a noise like chariots
Over mountaintops they leap,
Like the noise of a flaming fire that devours the stubble,
Like a strong people set in battle array.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before them the people writhe in pain;
All faces are drained of color.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They run like mighty men,
They climb the wall like men of war;
Every one marches in formation,
And they do not break ranks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not push one another;
Every one marches in his own column.
Though they lunge between the weapons,
They are not cut down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They run to and fro in the city,
They run on the wall;
They climb into the houses,
They enter at the windows like a thief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth quakes before them,
The heavens tremble;
The sun and moon grow dark,
And the stars diminish their brightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Now, therefore,” says the Lord,
“Turn to Me with all your heart,
With fasting, with weeping, and with mourning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who knows if He will turn and relent,
And leave a blessing behind Him—
A grain offering and a drink offering
For the Lord your God?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Gather the people,
Sanctify the congregation,
Assemble the elders,
Gather the children and nursing babes;
Let the bridegroom go out from his chamber,
And the bride from her dressing room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the priests, who minister to the Lord,
Weep between the porch and the altar;
Let them say, “Spare Your people, O Lord,
And do not give Your heritage to reproach,
That the nations should rule over them.
Why should they say among the peoples,
‘Where is their God?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord will be zealous for His land,
And pity His people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will answer and say to His people,
“Behold, I will send you grain and new wine and oil,
And you will be satisfied by them;
I will no longer make you a reproach among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But I will remove far from you the northern army,
And will drive him away into a barren and desolate land,
With his face toward the eastern sea
And his back toward the western sea;
His stench will come up,
And his foul odor will rise,
Because he has done monstrous things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be glad then, you children of Zion,
And rejoice in the Lord your God;
For He has given you the former rain faithfully,
And He will cause the rain to come down for you—
The former rain,
And the latter rain in the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The threshing floors shall be full of wheat,
And the vats shall overflow with new wine and oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten,
The crawling locust,
The consuming locust,
And the chewing locust,
My great army which I sent among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall eat in plenty and be satisfied,
And praise the name of the Lord your God,
Who has dealt wondrously with you;
And My people shall never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you shall know that I am in the midst of Israel:
I am the Lord your God
And there is no other.
My people shall never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And it shall come to pass afterward
That I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh;
Your sons and your daughters shall prophesy,
Your old men shall dream dreams,
Your young men shall see visions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And also on My menservants and on My maidservants
I will pour out My Spirit in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth:
Blood and fire and pillars of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun shall be turned into darkness,
And the moon into blood,
Before the coming of the great and awesome day of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it shall come to pass
That whoever calls on the name of the Lord
Shall be saved.
For in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be deliverance,
As the Lord has said,
Among the remnant whom the Lord calls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For behold, in those days and at that time,
When I bring back the captives of Judah and Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have cast lots for My people,
Have given a boy as payment for a harlot,
And sold a girl for wine, that they may drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, what have you to do with Me,
O Tyre and Sidon, and all the coasts of Philistia?
Will you retaliate against Me?
But if you retaliate against Me,
Swiftly and speedily I will return your retaliation upon your own head;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you have taken My silver and My gold,
And have carried into your temples My prized possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also the people of Judah and the people of Jerusalem
You have sold to the Greeks,
That you may remove them far from their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I will raise them
Out of the place to which you have sold them,
And will return your retaliation upon your own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sell your sons and your daughters
Into the hand of the people of Judah,
And they will sell them to the Sabeans,
To a people far off;
For the Lord has spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Proclaim this among the nations:
“Prepare for war!
Wake up the mighty men,
Let all the men of war draw near,
Let them come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Assemble and come, all you nations,
And gather together all around.
Cause Your mighty ones to go down there, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let the nations be wakened, and come up to the Valley of Jehoshaphat;
For there I will sit to judge all the surrounding nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe.
Come, go down;
For the winepress is full,
The vats overflow—
For their wickedness is great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision!
For the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun and moon will grow dark,
And the stars will diminish their brightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“So you shall know that I am the Lord your God,
Dwelling in Zion My holy mountain.
Then Jerusalem shall be holy,
And no aliens shall ever pass through her again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it will come to pass in that day
That the mountains shall drip with new wine,
The hills shall flow with milk,
And all the brooks of Judah shall be flooded with water;
A fountain shall flow from the house of the Lord
And water the Valley of Acacias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Egypt shall be a desolation,
And Edom a desolate wilderness,
Because of violence against the people of Judah,
For they have shed innocent blood in their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Judah shall abide forever,
And Jerusalem from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will acquit them of the guilt of bloodshed, whom I had not acquitted;
For the Lord dwells in Zion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
